fields.title: Principle #1
fields.text: Our highest priority is to satisfy the customer through early and continuous delivery of valuable software.

fields.title: Principle #2
fields.text: Welcome changing requirements, even late in development. Agile processes harness change for the customer's competitive advantage.

fields.title: Principle #3
fields.text: Deliver working software frequently, from a couple of weeks to a couple of months, with a preference to the shorter timescale.

fields.title: Principle #4
fields.text: Business people and developers must work together daily throughout the project.

fields.title: Principle #5
fields.text: Build projects around motivated individuals. Give them the environment and support they need, and trust them to get the job done.

fields.title: Principle #6
fields.text: The most efficient and effective method of conveying information to and within a development team is face-to-face conversation.

fields.title: Principle #7
fields.text: Agile processes promote sustainable development. The sponsors, developers, and users should be able to maintain a constant pace indefinitely.

fields.title: Principle #8
fields.text: Continuous attention to technical excellence and good design enhances agility.

fields.title: Principle #9
fields.text: Simplicity--the art of maximizing the amount of work not done--is essential.

fields.title: Principle #10
fields.text: The best architectures, requirements, and designs emerge from self-organizing teams.

fields.title: Principle #11
fields.text: At regular intervals, the team reflects on how to become more effective, then tunes and adjusts its behavior accordingly.

fields.title: Principle #12
fields.text: Responding to change over following a plan
